misuses.description: The method uses a user-provided cipher algorithm name, which can lead to vulnerabilities if the user provides an invalid or malicious algorithm name.
misuses.recommendation: Use a whitelist of approved cipher algorithm names to prevent users from providing unintended algorithms.

misuses.description: The method uses a 56-bit key for the cipher, which is vulnerable to brute force attacks.
misuses.recommendation: Use a key size of at least 128-bits to ensure adequate security.

misuses.description: The method uses the Electronic Codebook (ECB) mode, which can lead to plaintext attacks.
misuses.recommendation: Use a secure mode such as CBC or GCM to ensure confidentiality.
